acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

addQuoteAsset(address).details: Needs to be called by the owner Reverts if: - The quoteAsset is already whitelisted

params.activeId: The active id of the pair
params.binStep: The bin step in basis point, used to calculate log(1 + binStep / 10_000)
params.tokenX: The address of the first token
params.tokenY: The address of the second token

returns.pair: The address of the newly created LBPair

forceDecay(address).details: Needs to be called by the owner

params.pair: The pair to force the decay

params.tokenX: The first token of the pair
params.tokenY: The second token of the pair

returns.flashLoanFee: The fee for flash loans, in 1e18

returns.lbPair: The address of the LBPair at index `index`

returns.lbPairImplementation: The address of the LBPair implementation

params.binStep: The bin step of the LBPair
params.tokenA: The address of the first token of the pair
params.tokenB: The address of the second token of the pair

params.binStep: The bin step of the preset

returns.decayPeriod: The decay period of the preset
returns.filterPeriod: The filter period of the preset
returns.isOpen: Whether the preset is open or not
returns.maxVolatilityAccumulator: The max volatility accumulator of the preset
returns.protocolShare: The protocol share of the preset
returns.reductionFactor: The reduction factor of the preset
returns.variableFeeControl: The variable fee control of the preset

returns.asset: The address of the quoteAsset at index `index`

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

returns._0: Whether the account has the role or not

params.feeRecipient: The address of the fee recipient
params.flashLoanFee: The value of the fee for flash loan

returns.isQuote: Whether the token is a quote asset or not

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

removeLBHooksOnPair(address,address,uint.details: Needs to be called by an address with the LB_HOOKS_MANAGER_ROLE Reverts if: - The pair doesn't exist

params.binStep: The bin step in basis point, used to calculate the price
params.tokenX: The address of the first token
params.tokenY: The address of the second token

removePreset(uint16).details: Needs to be called by the owner Reverts if: - The binStep doesn't have a preset

removeQuoteAsset(address).details: Needs to be called by the owner Reverts if: - The quoteAsset was not whitelisted

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setFeeRecipient(address).details: Needs to be called by the owner Reverts if: - The feeRecipient is `address(0)` - The feeRecipient is the same as the current one

setFeesParametersOnPair(address,address,.details: Needs to be called by the owner Reverts if: - The pair doesn't exist

params.baseFactor: The base factor, used to calculate the base fee, baseFee = baseFactor * binStep
params.binStep: The bin step in basis point, used to calculate the price
params.decayPeriod: The period where the accumulator value is decayed, by the reduction factor
params.filterPeriod: The period where the accumulator value is untouched, prevent spam
params.maxVolatilityAccumulator: The max value of volatility accumulator
params.protocolShare: The share of the fees received by the protocol
params.reductionFactor: The reduction factor, used to calculate the reduction of the accumulator
params.tokenX: The address of the first token
params.tokenY: The address of the second token
params.variableFeeControl: The variable fee control, used to control the variable fee, can be 0 to disable it

setFlashLoanFee(uint256).details: Needs to be called by the owner Reverts if: - The flashLoanFee is the same as the current one - The flashLoanFee is above the maximum flash loan fee

params.flashLoanFee: The value of the fee for flash loan

setLBHooksParametersOnPair(address,addre.details: Needs to be called by an address with the LB_HOOKS_MANAGER_ROLE Reverts if: - The pair doesn't exist - The hooks is `address(0)` or the hooks flags are all false

params.binStep: The bin step in basis point, used to calculate the price
params.onHooksSetData: The data to pass to the onHooksSet function
params.tokenX: The address of the first token
params.tokenY: The address of the second token

setLBPairIgnored(address,address,uint16,.details: Needs to be called by the owner Reverts if: - The pair doesn't exist - The ignored state is already in the same state

params.binStep: The bin step in basis point of the pair
params.ignored: Whether to ignore (true) or not (false) the pair for routing
params.tokenX: The address of the first token of the pair
params.tokenY: The address of the second token of the pair

setLBPairImplementation(address).details: Needs to be called by the owner

setPreset(uint16,uint16,uint16,uint16,ui.details: Needs to be called by the owner Reverts if: - The binStep is lower than the minimum bin step

params.baseFactor: The base factor, used to calculate the base fee, baseFee = baseFactor * binStep
params.binStep: The bin step in basis point, used to calculate the price
params.decayPeriod: The period where the accumulator value is decayed, by the reduction factor
params.filterPeriod: The period where the accumulator value is untouched, prevent spam
params.maxVolatilityAccumulator: The max value of the volatility accumulator
params.protocolShare: The share of the fees received by the protocol
params.reductionFactor: The reduction factor, used to calculate the reduction of the accumulator
params.variableFeeControl: The variable fee control, used to control the variable fee, can be 0 to disable it

setPresetOpenState(uint16,bool).details: Needs to be called by the owner Reverts if: - The binStep doesn't have a preset - The preset is already in the same state

params.binStep: The bin step in basis point, used to calculate the price
params.isOpen: Whether the preset is open or not

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner.

addQuoteAsset(address).notice: Function to add an asset to the whitelist of quote assets

createLBPair(address,address,uint24,uint.notice: Create a liquidity bin LBPair for tokenX and tokenY

forceDecay(address).notice: Function to force the decay of the volatility accumulator of a pair

getAllBinSteps().notice: View function to return the list of available binStep with a preset

getAllLBPairs(address,address).notice: View function to return all the LBPair of a pair of tokens

getFlashLoanFee().notice: Get the fee for flash loans, in 1e18

getLBPairAtIndex(uint256).notice: View function to return the LBPair created at index `index`

getLBPairImplementation().notice: Get the address of the LBPair implementation

getLBPairInformation(address,address,uin.notice: Returns the LBPairInformation if it exists, if not, then the address 0 is returned. The order doesn't matter

getMaxFlashLoanFee().notice: Get the maximum fee percentage for flashLoans

getMinBinStep().notice: Get the minimum bin step a pair can have

getNumberOfLBPairs().notice: View function to return the number of LBPairs created

getNumberOfQuoteAssets().notice: View function to return the number of quote assets whitelisted

getOpenBinSteps().notice: View function to return the list of open binSteps

getPreset(uint256).notice: View function to return the different parameters of the preset Will revert if the preset doesn't exist

getQuoteAssetAtIndex(uint256).notice: View function to return the quote asset whitelisted at index `index`

hasRole(bytes32,address).notice: Returns whether the caller has the role or not, only the owner has the DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE

isQuoteAsset(address).notice: View function to return whether a token is a quotedAsset (true) or not (false)

removeLBHooksOnPair(address,address,uint.notice: Function to remove the hooks contract from the pair

removePreset(uint16).notice: Remove the preset linked to a binStep

removeQuoteAsset(address).notice: Function to remove an asset from the whitelist of quote assets

setFeeRecipient(address).notice: Function to set the recipient of the fees. This address needs to be able to receive ERC20s

setFeesParametersOnPair(address,address,.notice: Function to set the fee parameter of a LBPair

setFlashLoanFee(uint256).notice: Function to set the flash loan fee

setLBHooksParametersOnPair(address,addre.notice: Function to set the hooks parameters of a pair

setLBPairIgnored(address,address,uint16,.notice: Function to set whether the pair is ignored or not for routing, it will make the pair unusable by the router

setPreset(uint16,uint16,uint16,uint16,ui.notice: Sets the preset parameters of a bin step

setPresetOpenState(uint16,bool).notice: Sets if the preset is open or not to be used by users

typeDescriptions.typeString: mapping(contract IERC20 => mapping(contract IERC20 => mapping(uint256 => struct ILBFactory.LBPairInformation)))
mapping(contract IERC20 => mapping(contract IERC20 => mapping(uint256 => struct ILBFactory.LBPairInformation)))

documentation.text:
@dev Mapping from a (tokenA, tokenB) to a set of available bin steps, this is used to keep track of the
 bin steps that are already used for a pair.
 The tokens are ordered to save gas, but they can be in the reverse order in the actual pair.
 Always query one of the 2 tokens of the pair to assert the order of the 2 tokens
